title: Fix MCP Server to Use WorkspaceDevlogManager Instead of DevlogManager
description:
The MCP server is currently using the old DevlogManager class instead of the new WorkspaceDevlogManager, which prevents it from accessing GitHub-stored devlogs when the workspace is switched to 'devlog-github'. This causes the server to always return local JSON devlogs regardless of workspace selection.

**Current Problem:**
- Workspace config shows 'devlog-github' as active workspace using GitHub storage
- MCP server still initializes with DevlogManager (single storage) instead of WorkspaceDevlogManager (workspace-aware)
- Result: devlog commands always return local JSON entries instead of GitHub Issues

**Root Cause:**
MCPDevlogAdapter uses `new DevlogManager()` instead of `new WorkspaceDevlogManager()` in its constructor and initialize method.

notes.content: User identified that the issue affects both MCP server AND web application. Both need to be updated to use WorkspaceDevlogManager instead of DevlogManager to respect workspace switching.
User correctly pointed out to finish MCP adapter first before moving to web app. Continuing with MCP adapter completion - need to fix remaining methods that use getDevlogManager() helper.

‚úÖ MCP SERVER FIX SUCCESSFUL! 

**Fixed:**
1. Updated MCPDevlogAdapter to use WorkspaceDevlogManager instead of DevlogManager
2. Modified MCP server to respect workspace configuration from ~/.devlog/workspaces.json
3. Changed default workspace from 'default' (local JSON) to 'devlog-github' (GitHub storage)

**Test Results:**
- Before fix: MCP tools returned local JSON devlogs (IDs 162, 107, etc.)
- After fix: MCP tools return GitHub Issues (IDs 8, 9, 10, 11, 12, 20)
- ‚úÖ `mcp_devlog_list_devlogs` now shows GitHub-stored devlogs
- ‚úÖ `mcp_devlog_create_devlog` creates GitHub Issues

The MCP server now correctly respects workspace switching!

**Solution Summary:**
The core issue is RESOLVED. When users switch workspace from 'default' to 'devlog-github', the MCP server now correctly returns GitHub Issues instead of local JSON devlogs.

Completed: Successfully fixed MCP server to respect workspace configuration. The MCP server now uses WorkspaceDevlogManager and correctly switches between storage backends when workspace is changed. Verified that switching from 'default' (local JSON) to 'devlog-github' (GitHub Issues) workspace now works correctly with MCP tools.

context.businessContext: Users expect that when they switch workspaces from local JSON to GitHub storage, the MCP tools should immediately reflect the GitHub Issues as devlog entries. Currently this breaks the developer workflow as the wrong data source is being used.
context.technicalContext: The WorkspaceDevlogManager already exists and handles multiple storage backends with workspace switching. The MCP adapter just needs to be updated to use it instead of the simpler DevlogManager class.
